ref: 6116 dákṣa ʻ able, clever ʼ, m. ʻ ability, skill (of hostile or in- jurious being) ʼ RV. [√dakṣ]
Pa. dakkha -- ʻ skilled ʼ, n. ʻ skill ʼ;
S. ḍ̠akho m. ʻ menace, threatened assault ʼ;
P. dakkh ʻ beautiful ʼ, m. ʻ taste, relish ʼ;
Si. das ʻ clever ʼ, sb. ʻ skill ʼ; -- with ʻ intrusive ʼ r:

lang: Gāndhārī or Northwest Prakrit (as recorded in the Dharmapada ed. J. Brough, Oxford 1962)
ref: Dhp. drakṣu ʻ intelligence ʼ Brough Dhp 253.
